intro: Hieracium pseudohastaefolium, commonly known as the slender-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium pseudohastaefolium is often found in temperate regions and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
